com.example.library.backend

Class UserService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.library.backend.UserService

  • public class UserService
extends java.lang.Object
    this class contains all of the methods for dealing with different actions regarding a user, it also contains methods for checking log in credentials

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checklogIn(java.lang.String account, java.lang.String password)
      the checkLogIn method works by first making sure that the account passed to it is not null, then does a simple string comparison to find out if the given account's password matches the attempted password
      int count() 
      boolean delete(User value)
      Delete a user from the database

      Check format of user information
      static UserService initialize()
      Initialize function
      java.lang.String register(java.lang.String account, java.lang.String password)
      the register functions works by receiving an account and password, and then checking if the formatChecking function returns true, if so, then a user object is created and added to the JPAContainer
      void replace(User user)
      'replace' works by deleting a given user, and then saving them, ultimately ending up with a new copy of the user's instance
      void save(User entry)
      adding a user to the User JPAContainer

        public int count()

        Delete a user from the database
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • replace

        public void replace(User user)
        'replace' works by deleting a given user, and then saving them, ultimately ending up with a new copy of the user's instance
        Parameters:
        user - the instance need to be updated

      • save

        public void save(User entry)
        adding a user to the User JPAContainer

        entry - the user instance need to be saved

      • checklogIn

        public boolean checklogIn(java.lang.String account,
                          java.lang.String password)
        the checkLogIn method works by first making sure that the account passed to it is not null, then does a simple string comparison to find out if the given account's password matches the attempted password

      • getUser

        public User getUser(java.lang.String account,
                    java.lang.String password)
        returning a requested user object
        Parameters:
        account - Account number of the user
        password - Password of the user
        Returns:
        User account if password and account match, null if it doesn't match

      • register

        public java.lang.String register(java.lang.String account,
                                 java.lang.String password)
        the register functions works by receiving an account and password, and then checking if the formatChecking function returns true, if so, then a user object is created and added to the JPAContainer

      • informationCheck

        public boolean informationCheck(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String email,
                                java.lang.String phone)
                         throws FormatCheckFailedException
        Check format of user information
        Parameters:
        name - User name
        email - User email
        phone - User phone
        Returns:
        true when all information matches the format
        Throws:
        FormatCheckFailedException - with specific error informaiton
